wikipedia_page.main: Rosa Clementina Petherick (September 1871 – 20 December 1931) was a British book illustrator.

response: Two Little New Zealanders, (illustrated by Rosa C. Petherick), Sunday School Union, London, 1909
*Horace William Petherick (1839-1919). A British artist, book illustrator, violin enthusiast and father of Rosa C. Petherick

Graves is known for two books published round the turn of the 20th century: The House by the Railway (1896) illustrated by Rosa C. Petherick and Four Little People and their Year at Silverhaven (1898) illustrated by Florence Meyerheim.Joanne Shattock The Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature, Vol.4 1800-1900, Cambridge University Press, 2000 p.2390  She also wrote The Little Brown House (1902).

*March, 1906: C. W. English presented a presented a paper on Francesco Stradivari, Antonio's son, and exhibited nearly twenty different instrument made by him. The musical honors were provided by Herbert Walenn and the Petherick Quartet (composed of Rosa C. Petherick's four sisters).
